day_summary.title: Day 6 Recitation Summary (An-Nisaa 147-176, Al-Maaida 1-81)
day_summary.summary: Day 6 moves from calls to gratitude, sincerity, and clarity of belief into major ethical foundations in Al-Maaida: covenant, justice, cooperation in righteousness, and steadfast moral responsibility.
themes: Faith is sustained through gratitude, truthfulness, and clear commitment to revelation.
Justice and principled conduct are non-negotiable, even under tension or bias.
Communal strength comes from cooperation in taqwa and refusing to normalize wrongdoing.

whyNotable: One of the most cited Quranic principles for collective ethics and community conduct.
Frequently used as a foundational ayah in dawah, masjid work, and social responsibility.
highlights.summary: Allah commands believers to support one another in virtue and taqwa, and forbids cooperation in sin and transgression. It sets a clear framework for principled collaboration.
highlights.keyTakeaway: Build community work on righteousness, not expediency.

whyNotable: A major and widely quoted ayah on principled justice.
Regularly referenced in khutbahs and Islamic ethics discussions.
highlights.summary: Believers are commanded to stand firmly for Allah in justice, without letting dislike of a people drive them to injustice. The ayah links justice directly to taqwa.
highlights.keyTakeaway: Remain just even when emotions pull in the opposite direction.

highlights.shortTitle: Seek Means to Allah and Strive
whyNotable: A very well-known ayah on drawing near to Allah through obedience and striving.
Often cited in lessons on worship discipline and spiritual effort.
highlights.summary: Allah commands taqwa, seeking nearness to Him, and striving in His cause for success. The ayah combines inward God-consciousness with outward effort.
highlights.keyTakeaway: Taqwa grows through action, striving, and closeness to Allah.

highlights.shortTitle: Allah Brings a People He Loves
whyNotable: A famous ayah describing the qualities of believers loved by Allah.
Commonly quoted in reminders on sincerity, humility, and courage in deen.
highlights.summary: Allah declares that if some turn away, He will bring a people He loves and who love Him: humble with believers, firm against opposition, and steadfast in striving for Allah.
highlights.keyTakeaway: Seek to be among those defined by love of Allah and principled courage.

whyNotable: A well-known warning passage on leaving wrong uncorrected.
Frequently taught in discussions of moral responsibility and communal reform.
highlights.summary: The ayat condemn persistent disobedience and emphasize that people were blameworthy for failing to restrain one another from evil. It is a direct warning against passive acceptance of wrongdoing.
highlights.keyTakeaway: Do not normalize sin; uphold sincere mutual accountability.
